page.title: 12CHANGES IN WILLOUGHBY
page.content: was no machinery about the time of the war not like there is today.Horses used to do all the work.{Milking}was done by hand,not by machinery.In {school}it was very hard and strict.The girls would once a week go to cookery classes in either Ruddington or Keyworth.The big classroom was divided into two by a curtain.In the top end near the entrance the 6 and 7 year old children worked and on the other side of the curtain the 8 to 14 year olds worked.The playground was not smooth,flat tarmac,it was bumpy and rough.The school is very different today.There is now a cabin across the playground where the Lower Juniors work.The girls and boys in the juniors go swimming every Monday to Keyworth swimming baths.None of the teachers lives in the school house;it is now privately owned.
